intro: Alyxia grandiflora, commonly known as the largeflower alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Alyxia grandiflora thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in dry, rocky soils.
